messages.message: I actually started with `ibdev-backend` but it's 2 days and still launching...

Seems to be stuck in a loop pulling the rabbitmq and redis images:

``` [D] rabbitmq     Ready     ✓ Pull:us-docker.pkg.dev/crafting-dev/sandbox/service/rabbitmq-3.11:latest 100%  
                            ✓ RestoreInitialSnapshot                                                         
                            ✓ LaunchService                                                                  
 [D] redis        Ready     ✓ Pull:us-docker.pkg.```
Not 100% clear why, and this is the first time I've seen this. I'll try putting the sandbox to sleep, and waking it again to see if that resolves the issue.
Separately, I'll reach out to Crafting, since those containers are managed by them in this template.

Ah, I see the problem! This is a problem with `node` while building `server-nginx` that is addressed in another PR I'm getting ready. @Vasu ran into the same problem (I did not, b/c my personal snapshot happens to initialize the right `node` version). Will fix this ASAP.

```[1/5] Resolving packages...
[2/5] Fetching packages...
error postcss-load-config@4.0.2: The engine "node" is incompatible with this module. Expected version ">= 14". Got "12.22.9"
error Found incompatible module.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/install for documentation about this command.
make[1]: *** [Makefile:39: install-deps] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/owner/instabase/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked'
make: *** [Makefile:37: prepare] Error 2
make: Leaving directory '/home/owner/instabase/webserver/server-nginx'```

Fix here: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/66380

Also identified another issue: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/66382
@Anant: Got your sandbox up. Sorry about the blip!
if I try to login via google -- it says not authorized -- do we get another URL that is not blocked via our SSO

Yes, you have to explicitly add the auth redirect URL for your sandbox to allow signup w/ Google. I think we should avoid doing that for every dev sandbox, b/c the list will get quite long. (Note: we are also considering adding a proxy that will redirect to the appropriate sandbox, to avoid this -- but this is WIP).

Can you create an account the old-fashioned way (email + password)?

yes -- I can. Was wondering if there is a way we can create a domain mapping (http://<abc.sandbox.instabase.com (http://sandbox.instabase.com)|<abc>.sandbox.instabase.com (http://sandbox.instabase.com)>) and our SSO approves everything under *.sandbox.instabase.com (http://sandbox.instabase.com)
Unfortunately, Google does not allow wildcards like that for oauth callbacks -- but we can emulate it using a proxy. We're looking into this for another unrelated project.
